key_responsibilities: Develop, coordinate, and manage all aspects of the Member’s schedule and logistics
Track, evaluate, and respond to all invitations and scheduling requests
Coordinate travel for the Member
Compile briefing materials
Provide operational support for the office
Facilitate Member to Member and stakeholder outreach
Coordinate internal and external events
Coordinate with legislative and press teams
Oversee coordination with other Member offices
Coordinate with campaign and non-official staff on political scheduling requests
requirements: Flexibility to respond to urgent scheduling needs outside of normal hours

office: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure
key_responsibilities: Tracking documents and ensuring that items adhere to the in-house style guide
Organizing and preparing for meetings and Committee events
Proof-reading content to ensure for accuracy
Assisting in maintaining Committee official records
Aiding the Committee counsels in organizing and documenting Committee markups
Ensuring that all Committee activities run smoothly
Assisting as the non-partisan Committee Clerk
Assisting in the preparation and filing of Committee legislative reports
Providing administrative support to Committee staff
requirements: Strong time management and organization skills
Minimum of two years previous Congressional experience
Knowledge of Congressional administrative rules and procedures
Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects
Ability to work well under pressure
Strong oral and written communication skills
Ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment

key_responsibilities: Providing operational support for committee activity
Providing administrative support for the office
Providing executive support to the Staff Director
Assisting in scheduling and support of external events
Tracking long-term requests to CAO and AOC
Maintaining adequate stock of office supplies and equipment
Serving as internship program coordinator
Coordinating staff assistants
requirements: Demonstrated experience in high-pressure work environments
At least one year of full-time experience on Capitol Hill in an operations role

key_responsibilities: Conducting legislative research
Drafting legislative memoranda
Assisting with oversight activities
Compiling materials for Members and staff
Maintaining legislative trackers
requirements: 1 to 3 years of demonstrated ability to conduct policy research and manage administrative duties
Enthusiasm for and some knowledge of Subcommittee issue areas
Superior written and oral communications skills
Ability to work both independently and as part of a team

key_responsibilities: Overseeing a community outreach and federal casework portfolio
Serving as the Office’s liaison to San Diego’s AANHPI communities; Indigenous communities
Covering issue areas, including health care and housing
requirements: Strong San Diego ties and experience working with diverse communities
Exceptional communication, organizational, and writing skills

key_responsibilities: Ensuring legislative staff focuses on Member’s policy goals
Proposing policy positions and formulating legislative solutions
Recommending strategies and tactics
Handling short-term and long-term legislative planning
Managing direction of legislative team
Monitoring and reporting floor action
Writing and reviewing legislative memos
Developing vote recommendations
Coordinating responses to legislative mail
Communicating and strategizing with the District Director
Maintaining up-to-date status reports on all legislation
Overseeing activities in the office in the absence of the Chief of Staff
requirements: Ability to work in face-paced environment
Prior experience as a Legislative Director or Senior Legislative Assistant
At least 2 years of management experience
Thorough understanding of the legislative process
Expertise and/or experience in judiciary related issues
Excellent oral and written communication skills

key_responsibilities: Managing Member’s daily and long-term DC schedule
Coordinating with Committee staff on hearings, meetings, and markups
Organizing and tracking invitations, speaking engagements and scheduling requests
Assisting in coordinating travel arrangements
Managing the intern program
Maintaining the DC office
Processing flag requests and White House tour requests
requirements: Capable of thriving in a fast-paced environment
Strong background in Outlook scheduling functions

key_responsibilities: Answering telephones
Greeting visitors
Processing flag and tour requests
Drafting correspondence
Driving the Member
Serving as Intern Coordinator
Advising Members of Congress on military justice and other military personnel policy matters
Evaluating budget requests and legislative proposals
Preparing for committee hearings and briefings
